text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Saturday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- President Hosni Mubarak discusses today with Palestinian President Yasser Arafat Israeli settlements in East Jerusalem and receives Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Tuesday. Arafat to deliver a speech today at the Arab League's extraordinary session, which will study a unified Arab stand in the issue of Israeli housing projects in Jerusalem.
- Foreign Minister Amr Moussa arrives in the United States tomorrow to prepare for Mubark's visit on March 10.
- Mubarak to receive Eritrean President Isayas Afewerki, who will arrive in Cairo today. The two presidents are expected to discuss latest developments in east Africa and bilateral relations.
- Egyptian-French contacts at the highest level are conducted before Mubarak's visit to the United States.
- Mubarak to discuss Jerusalem's crisis with Arafat and Netanyahu.
- The Egyptian ambassador in Washington, Ahmed Maher, says U.S. investments in Egypt are expected to increase.
